title: Aubameyang makes confident claim about Arsenal's Premier League top four chances
text:
Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang is confident Arsenal will finish in the top four of the Premier League (Picture: Getty)

Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang insists he is ‘sure’ Arsenal will secure a top-four finish in the Premier League this season.

The Gunners, who finished fifth in the English top-flight last term, have lost just one league fixture so far during the 2019-20 campaign, amassing 15 points from their eight matches.

Unai Emery’s side are currently fifth in the table but will climb above Chelsea and Leicester City into third if they defeat Premier League new-boys Sheffield United on Monday evening.

Aubameyang was speaking after receiving his Player of the Month award (Picture: Getty)

Aubameyang has enjoyed a superb start to the season, scoring eight goals in ten appearances, and was named the Premier League Player of the Month for September.

‘I feel great,’ Aubameyang said as he was presented with his second Premier League Player of the Month award. ‘I’m feeling free on the pitch.

‘I don’t know if it’s the best form of my career but it’s a good one so I will try to keep the level up.

‘I’m sure we will achieve the top four. That’s the goal. That’s our aim.’

Arsenal defender Sead Kolasinac has also backed the Gunners to break back into the top four this season.

He said: ‘We have had a solid start and were in third place before the international break, which was our goal for then.

‘We need to improve on a few things and we are looking to do that. We are working hard on that.

‘When we are all back, we are a really strong team. It is not only the 11 on the pitch, it is also the people on the bench, the people that are not in the squad, the whole club.

‘The Premier League isn’t called the hardest league in the world for nothing. It [the race for the top-four] is pretty wide open.

‘For example, Manchester City lost to Wolves before the international break. But we are just going to focus on ourselves and try to work hard to win every game.

‘Who knows what will happen at the end of the season? We are still at the beginning now, but we hope to finish in the top four.’

After facing Sheffield United, Arsenal return to Europa League action against Vitoria Sport Clube on Thursday night.
